required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of a Culturally-based Intervention on Sexual Risky Behavior Among Young American Indian Adolescents
clinical_study.official_title: Teen Pregnancy Prevention Among Native Youth of the Northern Plains

brief_summary.textblock: Youth who participate in the Circle of Life (COL) program will report less sexual risk taking behavior compared to youth who do not receive the program.

detailed_description.textblock: Youth who participate in the Circle of Life (COL) program will report less sexual risk taking behavior and fewer pregnancies compared to youth who do not receive the program.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention

primary_outcome.description: Onset of sexual activity is measured by youth self-reported answers in an online survey to a question on lifetime sexual activity. Specifically, youth are coded "1" if they report having had sex ever before in their lifetimes, "0" otherwise. In conjunction with age data and date of survey administration (also collected in the surveys), these questions provide us the timing (age) of onset of sexual activity. This question is repeated at each data collection point with youth who reported not ever having had sex at the prior survey. Over time, then, we can assess onset of sexual activity prospectively.

arm_group.description: Circle of Life is a culturally-based HIV-prevention intervention designed for American Indian and Alaska Native 10-12 year-olds. It includes both online and facilitated material.

After-School Science Plus is a curriculum designed for youth to teach science and literacy using everyday materials. It helps youth see how science is a part of everyday life and provides role models of scientists who come from different backgrounds and ethnicities.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Must be 10-12 years old at baseline (with parental consent)
- Must be a member of participating Native Boys and Girls Club
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not 10-12 years old at baseline (without parental consent)
- Not a member of participating Native Boys and Girls Club

overall_official.affiliation: University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus, Centers for American Indian and Alaska Native Health

facility.name: University of Colorado - Anschutz Medical Campus

reference.citation: Kaufman CE, Litchfield A, Schupman E, Mitchell CM. Circle of Life HIV/AIDS-prevention intervention for American Indian and Alaska Native youth. Am Indian Alsk Native Ment Health Res. 2012;19(1):140-53. doi: 10.5820/aian.1901.2012.140.
